name: Sanctuary Hotel New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved this place. The staff was so friendly and helpful. The decor was very cool, a bit on the dark side, but I don't mind. comfortable bed and awesome rain shower. Of course great location, we used the subway for most of our transportation, which is super close and accessible from the hotel. It was the most expensive hotel we stayed at during our 3 week trip in the states, but worth it.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: This hotel was recommended to me by work colleague and was brilliant . Times Square round the corner and so easy to get around to all the sights. Jacob and STAR team readily available to help at any time and when we showed a list of restuarants we had Jacob told us the best one and phoned ahead to book us for dinner . Reception and doormen always greeted us with a smile . Rooms are lovely I think my room was exceptional and was much bigger than most . Haven rooftop bar served cocktails before we went to a show. We were able to leave our luggage in safe room on last day and Jules organised taxi for airport whilst we shopped . Great team and fantastic hotel .
reviews.title: Sanctuary Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I visited New York as a treat for ourselves after my cancer treatment so were looking for somewhere special to stay.
reviews.title: Helped make our dream holiday perfect!

reviews.text: We wanted a base that was modern and centrally situated but at a reasonable price and definately got what we were looking for. The hotel's name is very apt, it really was our sanctuary in the middle of the madness that is New York. Walk out the front door, turn left and at the end of the street is Times Square and, in fact, all the major Midtown sites are within reasonable walking distance.
reviews.title: Great Boutique Hotel!

reviews.text: Disappointing... You'll discover that the "Sanctuary" theme is mostly a facade (with very very dark corridors). Great location, really nice continental breakfast, Jimmy, Lauren and Juan at the front desk were cheerful and fun, but all the other things are average... I don't think its worth the price they are charging...
reviews.title: Only because of the location...
Nice boutique hotel, extremely well situated
reviews.text: Great service and nice, though very small, rooms. Breakfast was good, and the staff was very accommodating of dietary restrictions. Extremely well situated near Times Square, yet quiet and peaceful. The bar got a bit loud and busy, but there was no noise up in the rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we entered the Sanctuary we knew that we had made the right choice of hotel.
reviews.title: Sanctuary Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were amazing and so helpful ,a special word of thanks to Billy and Hughes .
reviews.title: Nice but small for the price!

reviews.text: This is the perfect hotel for an overnight stay-cation! I booked a queen room for my husband's birthday. We started the evening with exquisite cocktails and tuna tartar at the rooftop lounge, which is trendy without being pretentious. Our room was tiny, as I expected, but had everything we needed to relax. Rain shower, soft and firm pillows, stocked minibar with snacks, duvet--no gross bedspread, dimable chandelier. The air conditioning wasn't quite cool enough at times and the "closet" was hilariously small, but I'm not complaining. This is not a place to spend a week, especially if you expect square footage. It's the perfect setting for a night away from real life.
reviews.title: delightfully impractical

reviews.text: Hotel is very nice ... warm staff, comfortable surroundings ... rooms are small, but perfectly fine ... bathroom is not separate from room ... perfectly acceptable when you are traveling alone.
reviews.title: A very nice place in Times Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lobby is intimate, mood lighting, great coffee bar ... but no where to go with a customer to have a meeting without background music.
reviews.title: Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Excellent stay
My vote for "best hotel in the world"
reviews.text: A friend who is a frequent visitor to NYC recommended this hotel, and it lived up to expectations as a well priced boutique hotel, within walking distance of of most places. Friendly staff, and a good service overall.

I took my daughter to NYC to celebrate her 18th Birthday, therefore I wanted a special hotel. Our travel agent sure chose the perfect hotel to make my babygirl feel very special! From the moment we walked in, Jimmy and Lauren made us feel like VIPs. While we were unpacking and getting situated, Jimmy came to our room with a special treat and birthday card personally signed by the whole staff for the birthday girl. So thoughtful!
reviews.title: Perfection!!

reviews.text: The location could not have been any more perfect. We were close and convenient to Times Square, the theaters, Central Park, Rockefeller Plaza,... everything! Sweet Brandon helped us choose the perfect restaurant for a celebration dinner after seeing a show on our first night in the city. He was so kind and eager to help to make our stay special.
reviews.title: Great location, great price, great people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was spotless and gorgeous! Our view was not amazing, but hey, It's New York City - I wasn't expecting an "ocean view". We had a building and fire escape out our window, but again... it's the city! We were extremely pleased with our room.
reviews.title: Perfect Location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was perfect. It had everything we could have wanted in the morning to start us off ready for our adventures in the city. I highly recommend The Sanctuary to anyone wanting to feel special. I've stayed in the chain hotels in NYC before, but nothing compares to this special little boutique hotel and the special staff running it!
reviews.title: Great little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic location 1 block from Times square. Less than a mile from Central Park. Only a couple blocks from Rockefeller Center. Nice continental breakfast in the am. The staff was kind and helpful. The rooftop deck is AMAZING ! The rooms are small but clean and sexy. Only slept in room and enjoyed New York. Spent 6 nights and did not want to leave. You cannot beat this place for the price.
reviews.title: Wonderful Weekend Retreat

description: The Sanctuary Hotel New York is located in the heart of midtown and steps away Times Square. This discrete boutique hotel offers highly personalized service with Sanctuary’s very own S.T.A.R.™ Program (Service Tailored to Any Request). Luxurious rooms are decorated with a rich warm palette that includes deep orange, chocolate brown and cognac. Leather headboards and crystal chandeliers add a touch of glamour, with pillow-top mattresses that compliment imported European sheets, duvets and terry. Each room includes iHome stereo systems that supports iPod, iPhone and iPad, HDTVs complete with premium movies, and Eco-friendly organic bath amenities. Sanctuary Hotel features a fireplace-adorned lobby with an energetic bar lounge offering signature cocktails. The hotel provides • Free Continental-style breakfast buffet• Free Wi-Fi• Free access to Equinox gym. S.T.A.R.™ Experience Managers are available to assist you with transportation services, restaurant reservations, theater and event tickets, to spa appointments or anything else that your heart may desire.
